meaningMnemonic:
<kanji>Join</kanji> and <kanji>join</kanji> with each other. This is an <vocabulary>annexation</vocabulary>, or a <vocabulary>merger</vocabulary>.

併合 generally means that one entity absorbs or incorporates another entity, often implying a dominant or controlling role by one of the parties.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own. Just remember that 合 is read as ごう here. Who orchestrated this <vocabulary>annexation</vocabulary>? Good ol' grandpa ごういち.
